packageMeta.name: purescript-textcursor
packageMeta.description: TextCursor type and functions for <input>/<textarea> selections

declarations.comments:
Direction ADT. None is the default. See
https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/forms.html#dom-textarea/input-selectiondirection
declarations.title: Direction

declarations.comments:
The `TextCursor` type represents text selection within an input element.
It consists of three regions of text: the text before the cursor, the text
selected, and the text after the selection. This allows replacements to
occur while keeping intact the cursor position/selection.
declarations.title: TextCursor

declarations.comments:
Get the current text in the field. (Everything before, inside, and after
the selection.)
declarations.title: content

declarations.comments: Get the content length.
declarations.title: length

declarations.comments: Test whether there is no content.
declarations.title: null

declarations.comments: An empty input field. No selection.
declarations.title: empty

declarations.comments: Create a `TextCursor` from three strings.
declarations.title: mkTextCursor

declarations.comments:
Apply a `Lens` setting a value to an empty `TextCursor`. When used with
`_before`, `_selected`, or `_after` this will provide a `TextCursor` with
only one non-empty field.
declarations.title: single

declarations.comments:
Lens for the text before the selection. Empty if the cursor is at the
beginning or the selection starts from the beginning.
declarations.title: _before

declarations.comments: Lens for the text that is selected. Empty if nothing is selected.
declarations.title: _selected

declarations.comments:
Lens for the text after the selection. Empty if the cursor or selection
reaches the end.
declarations.title: _after

declarations.comments: Lens for traversing/setting all three fields.
declarations.title: _all

declarations.comments: Test whether the cursor or selection touches the start.
declarations.title: atStart

declarations.comments: Test whether the cursor or selection reaches the end.
declarations.title: atEnd

declarations.comments: Test whether the cursor has selected the whole field.
declarations.title: allSelected

declarations.comments: Test whether the selection is collapsed, i.e. acts like a cursor.
declarations.title: isCursor

declarations.comments: Test whether the cursor is at the start with no selection.
declarations.title: cursorAtStart

declarations.comments: Test whether the cursor is at the end with no selection.
declarations.title: cursorAtEnd

declarations.comments: Test whether some text is selected.
declarations.title: isSelection

declarations.comments: Test whether there is a selection that starts at the beginning.
declarations.title: selectionAtStart

declarations.comments: Test whether there is a selection that reaches the end.
declarations.title: selectionAtEnd

declarations.comments:
Select all of the text in a field.

Note: selection direction is not specified.
declarations.title: selectAll

declarations.comments:
Place the cursor to the start of a field, preserving the overall text
content.
declarations.title: placeCursorAtStart

declarations.comments:
Place the cursor to the end of a field, preserving the overall text
content.
declarations.title: placeCursorAtEnd

declarations.comments: Modify just the selected region with an endomorphism.
declarations.title: modifySelected

declarations.comments:
Map all three regions of the `TextCursor` with an endomorphism, performing
a replacement or other transformation such as normalization.
declarations.title: modifyAll

declarations.comments: Prepend a string, on the left.
declarations.title: appendl

declarations.comments: Append a string, on the right.
declarations.title: appendr

declarations.comments:
Insert a string at the cursor position. If text is selected, the insertion
will be part of the selection. Otherwise it is inserted before the cursor.
declarations.title: insert

declarations.comments: Get the current text value of a `TextCursorElement`.
declarations.title: value

declarations.comments: Set the text value of a `TextCursorElement` to the specified string.
declarations.title: setValue

declarations.comments: Set the index of the start of the selection.
declarations.title: setSelectionStart

declarations.comments: Set the index of the end of the selection.
declarations.title: setSelectionEnd

declarations.comments: Set the direction of the selection
declarations.title: setSelectionDirection

declarations.comments: Get the index of the start of the selection.
declarations.title: selectionStart

declarations.comments: Get the index of the end of the selection.
declarations.title: selectionEnd

declarations.comments: Get the direction of the selection.
declarations.title: selectionDirection

declarations.comments:
A container for the two usable `Element` types:
- `HTMLInputElement`
- `HTMLTextAreaElement`

Note that not all `HTMLInputElement` nodes are valid, as they must contain
text content. See `validate` for specifics.

Common operations are defined in `TextCursor.Element.HTML`.
declarations.title: TextCursorElement

declarations.comments:
Convert from a `Foreign` error computation (type `F`) to a validated
`TextCursorElement`.
declarations.title: validate'

declarations.comments:
Validate a `TextCursorElement`. Input fields need to have one of the
following types when this is called:
- text (default)
- email
- search
- url
declarations.title: validate

declarations.comments: Read a `TextCursorElement` from the `target` field of an `Event`.
declarations.title: readEventTarget

declarations.comments: Look up a `TextCursorElement` by id and run an action if found.
declarations.title: lookupValidateAndDo

declarations.comments: Look up a `TextCursorElement` in the document by id.
declarations.title: lookupAndValidate

declarations.comments:
Convert a `TextCursorElement` to a generic `HTMLElement`. Useful for
`focus`.
declarations.title: htmlTextCursorElementToHTMLElement

declarations.comments: Get the `TextCursor` from a `TextCursorElement`.
declarations.title: textCursor

declarations.comments:
Set the `TextCursor` on a `TextCursorElement`. Calls `setValue`,
`setSelectionStart`, and `setSelectionEnd`.
declarations.title: setTextCursor

declarations.comments: Modifies the `TextCursor` on an element through the given endomorphism.
declarations.title: modifyTextCursor

declarations.comments:
Modifies the `TextCursor` on an element as well as setting the result in a
State+Eff monad via a lens. Useful for components processing input events!
declarations.title: modifyTextCursorST

declarations.comments: Focuses an element after setting the `TextCursor`.
declarations.title: focusTextCursor

declarations.comments: Looks up an element by id to focus with a `TextCursor`.
declarations.title: focusTextCursorById

declarations.comments: Get the current text value of a `TextCursorElement`.
declarations.title: value

declarations.comments: Set the text value of a `TextCursorElement` to the specified string.
declarations.title: setValue

declarations.comments: Get the index of the start of the selection.
declarations.title: selectionStart

declarations.comments: Set the index of the start of the selection.
declarations.title: setSelectionStart

declarations.comments: Get the index of the end of the selection.
declarations.title: selectionEnd

declarations.comments: Set the index of the end of the selection.
declarations.title: setSelectionEnd

declarations.comments: Get the direction of the selection.
declarations.title: selectionDirection

declarations.comments: Set the direction of the selection
declarations.title: setSelectionDirection

declarations.comments:
A container for the two usable `Element` types:
- `HTMLInputElement`
- `HTMLTextAreaElement`

Note that not all `HTMLInputElement` nodes are valid, as they must contain
text content. See `validate` for specifics.

Common operations are defined in `TextCursor.Element.HTML`.
declarations.title: TextCursorElement

declarations.comments:
Convert a `TextCursorElement` to a generic `HTMLElement`. Useful for
`focus`.
declarations.title: htmlTextCursorElementToHTMLElement

declarations.comments: Read a `TextCursorElement` from a `Foreign` type.
declarations.title: read'

declarations.comments: Read a `TextCursorElement` from the `target` field of an `Event`.
declarations.title: readEventTarget

declarations.comments:
Validate a `TextCursorElement`. Input fields need to have one of the
following types when this is called:
- text (default)
- email
- search
- url
declarations.title: validate

declarations.comments:
Convert from a `Foreign` error computation (type `F`) to a validated
`TextCursorElement`.
declarations.title: validate'

declarations.comments: Look up a `TextCursorElement` in the document by id.
declarations.title: lookupAndValidate

declarations.comments: Look up a `TextCursorElement` by id and run an action if found.
declarations.title: lookupValidateAndDo
